title: Set Property: _DebugSymbolsProduced=false
body:
### Issue Description

I am using VS2022 and with my MSTest project no matter how I set the debugtype properties I cannot seem to generate a symbol file (.PDB)

Looking through the verbose logs the property _DebugSymbolsProduced is true up until the following

`1>Target "_CheckForCompileOutputs" in file "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\MSBuild\Current\Bin\amd64\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets":
1>  Added Item(s): FileWrites=obj\Debug\net6.0\Test.Common.dll
1>  Added Item(s): FileWrites=obj\Debug\net6.0\refint\Test.Common.dll
1>  Set Property: _DocumentationFileProduced=false
1>  Set Property: _DebugSymbolsProduced=false`

I cannot figure out what is causing this.

 

### Versions & Configurations
MSBuildVersion                 = 17.3.0
